poem:
Title: Perinatal Portrait

Hospital ward,
white and cold,
fulfills disparity's narration.
Grit of birth
echoing within,
mothers bound by
heredity's unseen stitch.

In this land,
27% carry burden
cloaked in expectancy.
Shadows kiss cheeks
of mothers twice likely,
their hue: England's dusk.

By such figures,
we find illness,
pale and heavy,
measuring the cloak's depth.
Existence pulled, shaped,
by unseen hands––
Ask why,
England?
